root-qklxth2.label: Project
root-qklxth2.content: A project refers to the specific product, system, or feature that the technical writer is responsible for documenting.

hub-milxj6k.label: Technical Writer
hub-milxj6k.content: The technical writer will act as bridge between the people who build a product and the people who use it.

child-fnc8v27.label: 2. Doc scope
child-fnc8v27.content:
•	Who is the target audience?
     •	What type of document is required? 
     •	Type of deliverables

child-qlfz5og.label: 3. Analysis & planning
child-qlfz5og.content: •	Study the input and collect the necessary information.

child-wfkewnv.label: 4. Doc Outline
child-wfkewnv.content:
•	Introduction – Purpose of product.
    •	Prerequisites – What the user needs before starting.
    •	Getting Started – How to log in/create account.
    •	Using the Product – Step-by-step flows
    •	Troubleshooting – Common issues (noted from video/demo).
    •	FAQs – Anticipated user questions.
    •	Support – Contact info.

child-ynla6xd.label: 5. Doc stream-line
child-ynla6xd.content:
•	Write procedure / step by step instruction in each section defined in outline section.
     •	Add images from figma / other sources
     •	Cross verifies the procedure with actual flow and make sure the document follows the same.
     •	Keep language simple & task-oriented

child-0twqy11.label: 6. Review
child-0twqy11.content:
•	Do the self-review and make necessary changes, if required.
    •	Submit for peer review (i.e., stake holders / Project team / QA / Marketing / Sales
    •	Record feedback and update

child-61o253s.label: 7. Publish & maintain
child-61o253s.content:
•	If pdf, then share is respective platform i.e sharedrive or server and keep track of it.
•	Doc-as-code (Docusaurus & MkDocs) – publish in GitHub / Gitlab
•	Create a version of document for future updates.

child-rvv3yiy.label: Audience
child-rvv3yiy.content:
•	End-users (retail customers using the app).

    •   Internal teams (Business, Marketing and sales).

    •   Developers.

child-a2ethbh.label: Document Type
child-a2ethbh.content: •	Decide whether it’s a User Guide, Product Info Doc, API docs and Release Note.

child-5u998xv.label: Figma
child-5u998xv.content:
•	Screens → show what the UI looks like.
    •	Design specs → labels, button names, tooltips.
    •	Flow → clickable prototype gives idea of user navigation.

child-9gtgagi.label: Journey Demo Video
child-9gtgagi.content:
•	Walkthrough of how a user moves through the product.
    •	Narration often explains purpose behind each step.
    •	Captures “happy path” + sometimes errors.

child-psd4znv.label: Introduction
child-psd4znv.content: Gives users a high-level overview of the product. Explains the purpose, goals, and what problem the application solves. Helps set context before diving into steps.

child-y9ir2to.label: Prerequisites
child-y9ir2to.content: Lists what a user needs before starting. This could include system setup (device, browser, internet), personal information (ID, account details), or access requirements (login credentials, permissions). Ensures users are prepared and avoid errors mid-way.

child-2uumeht.label: Getting Started
child-2uumeht.content:
Explains how users can access the product (sign-up, login, or download the app).

Sets up the foundation for using the rest of the features.

child-aktisgf.label: Using the Product
child-aktisgf.content:
Step-by-step explanation of the main user journey. Screenshots from Figma are paired with clear instructions.

This is the core section where users actually learn how to complete tasks.

child-bk2ie36.label: Troubleshooting
child-bk2ie36.content:
Captures common issues users might face and their solutions. Can include error messages or edge cases highlighted in the demo video. 

Reduces support tickets by giving users quick fixes.

child-65qjk52.label: FAQs
child-65qjk52.content: Addresses common questions users are likely to ask (e.g., “What if I don’t get OTP?”, “Is my data safe?”). Builds confidence and reduces confusion without the need for support intervention.

child-wteolz8.label: Support
child-wteolz8.content: Provides ways for users to reach out (email, helpline, chatbot, in-app support). Acts as the safety net if users cannot resolve their issues using documentation.

child-yvfe7jd.label: Write Step-by-Step Instructions
child-yvfe7jd.content:
Pair each screenshot with clear, action-oriented text.

👉 Example: “Click Apply for Loan → Enter loan amount → Upload Aadhaar/PAN → Click Submit.”

child-oibue02.label: Cross-Check with Demo Video
child-oibue02.content:
Watch the demo video alongside your draft to ensure the written steps match the actual journey / flow.

👉 This helps catch missing steps, button name mismatches, or skipped flows.

child-7wnzzc3.label: Maintain Consistent Language
child-7wnzzc3.content:
Use the same terms as in the UI (from Figma).

👉 If the button says “Proceed”, don’t call it “Continue” in the doc. This reduces confusion.

child-hm2ix69.label: SME & Stakeholder Review
child-hm2ix69.content:
Share the draft with Product Managers, UX Designers, and Developers to validate accuracy.

👉 They confirm whether the documented steps, button labels, and flows match the intended product behavior.

child-rmi4esu.label: QA / Tester Validation
child-rmi4esu.content:
Have QA teams follow the guide while testing the product.

👉 This ensures the documentation aligns with the real build, not just the Figma or demo video.

child-bkhm6ek.label: Peer or Usability Review
child-bkhm6ek.content:
Ask another writer or a new user to follow the guide.

👉 If they can complete the journey without confusion, the doc is clear. If not, you know where edits are needed.

child-qwvsocn.label: Feedback Incorporation
child-qwvsocn.content:
Log reviewer comments and update the document.

👉 This step makes the document reliable and user-tested.

child-q491ghe.label: Choose Publishing Platform
child-q491ghe.content:
Decide where the documentation will live:
👉 Web Portal (Docusaurus) or PDF/Word for offline distribution.

This ensures accessibility for the intended audience.

child-lpiwp7a.label: Version Control & Release Alignment
child-lpiwp7a.content:
Store docs in a versioned repository (Git or document control system).

👉 Align updates with product releases so documentation changes roll out at the same time as features.

child-j0yrynv.label: Continuous Maintenance
child-j0yrynv.content:
Schedule regular checks with PM/QA to capture UI updates, and new features.

👉 Keep screenshots, terminology, and compliance info up to date so documentation never lags behind the product.

child-ennmwb8.label: Scrum
child-ennmwb8.content:
•	Large docs (User Guide, API Reference) are broken into manageable issues.

    •	Example: Instead of “Write User Guide,” you track:

       •	Extract content from Figma (issue).

       •	Draft “Apply for Loan” flow (issue).

       •	Draft KYC troubleshooting (issue).

                👉 Keeps progress steady and measurable.
